member.name: T:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy
member.summary: Defines the expiration details of a cache entry.

remarks.para: The instance contains the expiration details of a cache entry. When the cache object retrieves a cache entry, the policy is checked and if the expiration details is met, the entry is deleted from the cache.
The default constructor of creates a policy that does not expire (maximum value).
supports two types of expiration:

description.para: Absolute: The entry will expire at a specific time. To use this set to the desired date and time and leave to the default value of .
Sliding: The entry will expire if it has not been accessed after for a specific time. To use this set to the desired time span value and leave to the default value of .

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of with default parameters.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the members of this class as follows:

description.para: Set to . The item will never expire.
Set to . The item will never expire.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.Clone
member.summary: Creates an exact copy of this
member.returns: The result object.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.AbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the cache entry should be deleted after a specified duration.
member.value: The period of time that must pass before a cache entry is deleted. The default value is , meaning that the entry does not expire.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.SlidingExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicate whether the cache entry should be deleted if it has not been accessed in a given span of time.
member.value: The time span which the cache entry must be accessed before the cache entry is deleted from the cache. The default is which means that the item should not be expired based on a time span.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Caching.CacheItem
member.summary: Specifies a cache entry.

remarks.para: provides represents a cache entry. It has a string key and object value pair and an optional region.

When an item is added to the cache, the value is serialized and stored physically. Similarly when an item is retrived, the value is de-serialized. Hence, the is just a holder for the cached item and is not itself serialized or saved.

member.param: Unique identifier for this cache entry. This value will be stored in .

member.name: T:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities
member.summary: Set of features that a cache implementation provides.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.None
member.summary: (0x00000000)A cache implementation does not provide any of the features that are described in

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.InMemoryProvider
member.summary: (0x00000001)Cache implementation runs at least partially in memory

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.OutOfProcessProvider
member.summary: (0x00000002)Cache implementation runs out-of-process

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryChangeMonitors
member.summary: (0x00000004)Cache implementation supports the ability to create change monitors that monitor entries

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.AbsoluteExpirations
member.summary: (0x00000008)Cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries at a specific date and time

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.SlidingExpirations
member.summary: (0x00000010)Cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries that have not been accessed in a specified time span

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryUpdateCallback
member.summary: (0x00000020)Cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry is about to be removed from the cache

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryRemovedCallback
member.summary: (0x00000040)Cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry has been removed from the cache

member.name: F:Leadtools.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheRegions
member.summary: (0x00000080)Cache implementation supports the ability to partition its storage into cache regions

member.name: T:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache
member.summary: Represents LEADTOOLS support for a file cache.

remarks.para: implements and is the LEADTOOLS implementation of a file cache. It is used by the LEADTOOLS Documents classes when caching is required to store the document data.

To use a , set the property to a valid directory in your system or in a network share. then use the various methods and properties to add and retrieve cache items with optional expiration policies. The cache will store the items and their policies into disk using serialization and retrieve them using de-serialization.

Since the cache uses the global file system, it can be re-used after the application is terminated. does not store any state data and all the items are stroed in disk. For instance, the LEADTOOLS Documents Web Service creates an instance of with every method call. All instances point to the same and can therefore use the same items added in previous calls. The cache is thread and process safe.

provide support for regions which is used to group cache items belonging to the same logical object. These regions are created as sub-directories in the cache directory on disk. LEADTOOLS Documents classes uses the unique document identifier as the region name and hence can delete all the items belonging to a single document by deleting the region.
Items are purged from the cache if they have an absolute or sliding expiration policy. This is done when the item is accessed (it will be deleted if expired) or by the user by using or .

Since cache items that are not used will stay on disk, it is preferable to create a process for purging expired policies manually. This can be done by calling which will check the whole cache and delete any items that are expired.
This cache implementation also supports data items with values set to null. Thus it is always preferable to use or instead of relying to and checking for null.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.CopyCacheItemPolicy(Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a cache policy.
member.param: Source cache policy.
member.returns: Exact copy of , or null if is null.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.GetRegionName(System.String)
member.summary: Get the actual region name.
member.param: Region name (sub-directory)
member.returns: The actual region name.

remarks.para: Default implementation is to return the same value as or an empty string if is null. The region name is used by this class as a directory name. Derived classes can override this method to modify the directory name to use.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.GetCacheFilePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the path to the physical file holding the data for the specified item.
member.param: Unique item identifier.
Optional region (sub-directory) name.
member.returns: The physical file holding the data for the specified item.

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS Documents classes uses this method to quickly access the data of an item from the disk file. It speeds up access and updating the data if the value contain large amount of data such as an image file.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.GetPolicyFilePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the path to the physical file holding the policy for the specified item.
member.param: Unique item identifier.
Optional region (sub-directory) name.
member.returns: The physical file holding the policy for the specified item.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.BeginAdd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Begins adding a new cache item.
member.param: Unique item identifier.
Optional region (sub-directory) name.
member.returns: Returns the path to the physical file that will hold the data for the item on disk.

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS Documents classes uses this method to quickly add items. It speeds up access and updating the data if the value contain large amount of data such as an image file.
After this method returns, must be called to either commit this item into the cache or discard it.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.EndAdd(System.Boolean,System.String,Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy,System.String)
member.summary: Ends adding a new cache item and commit the changes.
member.param: true to commit this item to the cache, false to discard it.
Unique item identifier.
Expiration policy to use with this item.
Optional region (sub-directory) name.

remarks.para: LEADTOOLS Documents classes uses this method to quickly add items. It speeds up access and updating the data if the value contain large amount of data such as an image file.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.UpdatePolicy(System.String,Leadtools.Caching.CacheItemPolicy,System.String)
member.summary: Update the policy of an existing cache item.
member.param: Unique item identifier.
New expiration policy to use with this item.
Optional region (sub-directory) name.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.CheckPolicy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks the policy of an existing cache item or items in a region and purge it if it has expired.
member.param: Unique item identifier. If this value is null then all the items that belong to will be checked.
Optional region (sub-directory) name. If this value is null then all the items in the cache will be checked.
member.returns: true if the item has not yet expired, false otherwise.

remarks.para: This method checks the policy of the item if found. It its absolute or sliding expiration date is met, then it will be purged from the cache.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.CheckPolicies
member.summary: Checks the policy of all items in the cache and purge any item that has been expired.

remarks.para: Since cache items that are not used will stay on disk, it is preferable to create a process for purging expired policies manually. This can be done by calling which will check the whole cache and delete any items that are expired.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.DeleteRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Delets the specified region and all its data.
member.param: region (sub-directory) name. This value cannot be null.

remarks.para: This method deletes all the cache item belonging to the specified region regardless of their expiration policy. The LEADTOOLS Documents library will call this method to delete the items of a documents when it is disposed and not flagged to be saved in the cache.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.CacheDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the location on the file system to use for storing cache items.
member.value: The location on the file system to use for storing cache items. Default value is null.

remarks.para: This is the first property to set after an instance of is created. It must point to a valid directory on the file system or a network share with read/write access rights for the current process.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.AccessTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how long to wait between file access errors before an exception is thrown.
member.value: A value that determines how long to wait between file access errors before an exception is thrown. Default value is 4 seconds.

remarks.para: The cache uses a file system and the items can be accessed by multiple threads or even processes at the same. When the cache is updating a cache item or its policy, the file on disk is opened with exclusive write access. Meaning if another thread or process is trying to access the same item, an error is occured. In this case, the cache will re-try the access at specified small intervals till it succeeds. If it cannot access the file after , the exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.DefaultRegion
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the region to use when calling the properties and methods that do not use a region name.
member.value: The default policy when setting cache values using the indexer. Default value is null.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Caching.FileCache.DefaultPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the default policy when setting cache values using the properties and methods that do not use a region name.
member.value: The default policy when setting cache values using the indexer. Default value is null.

member.value: The binder to use when serializing cache items. Default value is null.

remarks.para: Set this value to a custom to allow serialization of complex user-data types.
